   Currently the UnionListWriter/UnionFixedSizeListWriter getField/close APIs seems incorrect.

BryanCutler commented on pull request #6101: ARROW-7472: [Java] Fix some incorrect behavior in UnionListWriter
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6101#discussion_r365952025
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/codegen/templates/UnionListWriter.java
 ##########
 @@ -85,7 +84,7 @@ public int getValueCapacity() {
 
   @Override
   public void close() throws Exception {
-
+    vector.close();
 
 Review comment:
   Should this close the `PromotableWriter`?

tianchen92 commented on pull request #6101: ARROW-7472: [Java] Fix some incorrect behavior in UnionListWriter
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6101#discussion_r366131942
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/codegen/templates/UnionListWriter.java
 ##########
 @@ -85,7 +84,7 @@ public int getValueCapacity() {
 
   @Override
   public void close() throws Exception {
-
+    vector.close();
 
 Review comment:
   promotableWriter.close only call IntWriter.close(for List<Int>) and won't clear ListVector.
   vector.close() will clear all.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

BryanCutler commented on pull request #6101: ARROW-7472: [Java] Fix some incorrect behavior in UnionListWriter
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6101#discussion_r367187553
 
 

 ##########
 File path: java/vector/src/main/codegen/templates/UnionListWriter.java
 ##########
 @@ -85,7 +84,7 @@ public int getValueCapacity() {
 
   @Override
   public void close() throws Exception {
-
+    vector.close();
 
 Review comment:
   I meant close the `PromotableWriter` in addition to closing the `ListVector`. It might not be necessary, but if it doesn't hurt then it's better to be safe and close both I think.
